macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: S&P 500 Hits Fresh All-Time Intraday High on January 28
items.summary: The S&P 500 Index rose over 0.4%, led by Technology sector gains, testing record closing highs around 6980 and approaching the 7000 psychological threshold. Investors shrugged off government shutdown and geopolitical concerns ahead of tech earnings.

items.title: Dow Jones Drops 0.8% to Close at 49,003.41 on January 28
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 408.99 points or 0.8%, with 18 of its 30 components ending lower amid mixed market performance.

items.title: Market Outlook Highlights Manufacturing Tailwinds and Caterpillar as Bellwether
items.summary: Equity Clock's January 28 outlook notes economic data showing manufacturing and AI tailwinds, positions Caterpillar (CAT) as a key signal, and confirms emerging markets leadership amid US dollar weakness.

items.title: Investor Sentiment Turns Bullish with Put-Call Ratio at 0.74
items.summary: Investor sentiment on January 28 ended bullish, as measured by a put-call ratio of 0.74, supporting continued equity positioning despite seasonal volatility risks.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: MEXC Lists XYZ Token on January 29 with $50,000 USDT Incentives
items.summary: MEXC is listing XYZVerse's native token XYZ for the first time via XYZ/USDT pair at 13:00 UTC on January 29, following a presale that raised nearly $16 million. The listing aligns with investor interest in new crypto projects amid Bitcoin trading below $100,000.

items.title: Bitcoin Rises 2.61% to $90,168 and XRP Up 2.74% Ahead of Fed Rate Decision
items.summary: Bitcoin climbed 2.61% to $90,168 and XRP rose 2.74% to $1.93 in the past 24 hours as markets anticipate the Federal Reserve's first 2026 policy decision. Ether also gained 4.29% to $3,035 amid trader focus on Jerome Powell's comments.

items.title: SEC Agrees to Dismiss Enforcement Case Against Winklevoss Twins' Gemini Exchange
items.summary: The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission has agreed to dismiss its enforcement action against Gemini, the cryptocurrency exchange founded by the Winklevoss twins. This marks a significant regulatory development for the crypto industry.

items.title: Fed Holds Rates Steady at 3.50%-3.75%; Crypto Markets Remain Near $2.7 Trillion
items.summary: Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell reiterated a data-dependent stance after holding interest rates at 3.50%-3.75%, with no guidance on future cuts. Total crypto market cap excluding stablecoins held steady near $2.7 trillion post-announcement.

items.title: Ethereum Stabilizes with Higher Lows; Bitcoin Faces EMA Resistance Battle
items.summary: Ethereum shows signs of recovery by printing higher lows after defending $2,800 support, while Bitcoin battles bearish pressure from 26 and 50 EMAs around $90,000. Analysts eye Bitcoin's potential push to $94,000-$96,000 if resistance breaks.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: GTA 6 May Launch Digitally First Without Physical Discs to Prevent Leaks
items.summary: Rockstar Games is reportedly planning a digital-only release for GTA 6 on November 19, 2026, with physical copies delayed weeks or months later to avoid spoilers and leaks. This strategy signals a potential shift in AAA game launches toward digital prioritization.

items.title: Arcade Archives QUESTER and Arcade Archives 2 QUESTER Release Today
items.summary: HAMSTER Corporation launches Arcade Archives QUESTER on Nintendo Switch and PS4, and Arcade Archives 2 QUESTER on Nintendo Switch 2, PS5, and Xbox Series X|S, both digitally available on January 29, 2026. The 1987 brick-breaker game features 33 rounds with power-ups and ball-splitting mechanics.

items.title: The Division 2 Launches Assassin's Creed Collaboration Event
items.summary: A limited-time Assassin's Creed event begins January 29 through February 10 in The Division 2, offering unlockable apparel inspired by Ezio Auditore and Edward Kenway, plus weapon skins and trophies via a free and paid Event Pass.

items.title: Indie Game Award 2026 Winners Announced at Taipei Game Show
items.summary: The Indie Game Award 2026, hosted by Taipei Game Show, has revealed its winners, recognizing top indie titles in Asia's leading game industry awards program.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
